audio_item.dc.title: Sound Recording - Church Groundbreaking - 1951
audio_item.dc.contributor.author: West Side United Methodist Church (Ann Arbor, Michigan)
audio_item.dc.rights.access: This material is available for research only in the Reading Room of the Bentley Historical Library at the University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI).

audio_item.dc.description: Content note: The sound recording(s) associated with this repository item derive from a single audio reel tape. A single tape may yield multiple audio files if there were variations in tape stock, speed, or channels (i.e. stereo or mono). For more information see http://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/handle/2027.42/108126.
audio_item.dc.abstract: [Side 1] : [Part 1] : Groundbreaking; Pentron. Unidentified speaker dedicating the church with a prayer and invocation for the Church.
[Side 2] : [Part 2] : [Segment 1] : Groundbreaking; Pentron. Discussion of the new church and speeches from members of the church about Youth Group and Sunday School.
[Side 2] : [Part 2] : [Segment 2] : Groundbreaking; Pentron. Silence for the first minute, speaker giving instructions on how to use tape recorder; very distorted.
